docs.lead_paragraph: We're used to hearing about public initiatives that get mired in politics or entangled in bureaucracy, but we rarely hear about programs that exceed expectations. So here's one: last week marked the one-year anniversary of a program called text4baby, a service that sends free text messages to women who are pregnant or whose babies are less than a year old, providing them with information, and reminders, to improve their health and the health of their babies.
docs.abstract: A free service, text4baby, delivers crucial health advice via text message to pregnant women and new mothers.
docs.snippet: A free service, text4baby, delivers crucial health advice via text message to pregnant women and new mothers.

docs.lead_paragraph: As I reported last week, many parents in New York City are worried about the presence of the chemicals known as PCBs in light fixtures and caulking in school buildings. The latest spot inspection by the federal Environmental Protection Agency -- on Jan. 29 at Public School 68 in the Bronx -- turned up lighting ballasts that were leaking PCBs above the regulatory level of 50 parts per million in 10 of 13 samples taken, the agency announced Monday. Over the past several weeks, the E.P.A. found similar contamination at all three other city schools that it inspected, too.

headline.main: Q. and A.: PCBs in School Classrooms

docs.abstract: Experts say that the PCBs leaking from fixtures in New York City schools pose no immediate risk but that the lighting should be replaced promptly.
docs.snippet: Experts say that the PCBs leaking from fixtures in New York City schools pose no immediate risk but that the lighting should be replaced promptly.

docs.abstract: Poverty -- and prosperity -- can be hard to measure precisely, leaving unclear how many Americans fare, an economist writes.

byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and WILLIAM NEUMAN

docs.lead_paragraph: ''Until we see a sustained period of stronger job creation, we cannot consider the recovery to be truly established.'' Ben Bernanke, chairman of the Federal Reserve. ''It is much more than a currency. It is the embodiment of Europe today.'' Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany, talking about the euro. ''Enjoy your food, but eat less.'' From the latest nutrition advice issued by federal regulators, who also urged people to drink water instead of soda, eat more fruits and vegetables and cut down on processed foods. ''This reflects the dire fiscal circumstances the city faces.'' Marc La Vorgna, a spokesman for Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg of New York, who has proposed sweeping changes to the city's costly pension system. ''I don't see success for someone like me who doesn't understand the law. But it's better than nothing.'' Skylar Perea of Albuquerque, who is working without a lawyer to save her home from foreclosure. She fell behind on her mortgage payments during the eight months she was unemployed.
docs.snippet: ''Until we see a sustained period of stronger job creation, we cannot consider the recovery to be truly established.'' Ben Bernanke, chairman of the Federal Reserve. ''It is much more than a currency. It is the embodiment of Europe today.''...

docs.lead_paragraph: Luis Cedeño knows a thing or two about the right mix. In the 1970s, entranced by D.J. Kool Herc's mastery of the turntables, he got behind the wheels of steel himself and gained fame as Disco Wiz, a trailblazing Latino hip-hop D.J. Three decades later, he is still obsessed with the mix - the one found on his plate.

headline.main: A D.J. Gets Control of His Lifestyle as Well as His Tunes

docs.abstract: In the 1970s, Luis Cedeño gained fame as the D.J. Disco Wiz; three decades later, he is still obsessed with the mix, but now it's the one on his dinner plate.
docs.snippet: In the 1970s, Luis Cedeño gained fame as the D.J. Disco Wiz; three decades later, he is still obsessed with the mix, but now it's the one on his dinner plate.
